TopicTitle: what emotions do you get from the ksp songs?

Articles.Content: i have a combination of loneliness,wonder, calmness and fear, there's this one song that plays-the whale song , hearing it just makes me feel lonely
Apart from the main theme and the music in the science lab, nothing but pure annoyance. I play with muted music.
Anger and annoyance! We need new songs!
I actually really like the music in KSP. :/ I think it conveys that "empty space" feeling pretty well.

That space music is usually my orbital notification if i was looking else where. I actually like it as it feels like 'space' genre, but recently has muted music because i play my own track or stream stuffs while in SPH/VAB. But if i were to say emotion, then i maybe feel non.
The music selection in KSP really reminds me of The Sims, personally.
The space music and the main theme provoke wonder and awesomeness from me. I have spent so much time in the editor though, the music there just annoys me.
It makes me fear that at any second of my journey, I may be thwarted by gigantic space whales...

The old tunes are great but after 2000+ of game time it is boring me to hear them over and over.

Hey Squad, how about to make the songs interchangeable. Give the player a window where he can set options to which song will be played in which location.

In addition to that let the game pick random songs from a folder filled with the players MP3's.

Let me leave this here

None really, but that's almost certainly because I've heard them at least a hundred times each. I usually end up playing other music over the game anyway; iTunes has a weird (yet convenient) habit of playing parts of the Transformers film score* when I'm launching rockets. Much more interesting to launch to that than to have silence for a few minutes followed by the inevitable "Frost Waltz" at 69km

*Pretty much the entirety music collection is film and video game music.

I started to get a little annoyed with the VAB music one night, so I muted it and just started listening to my own tunes.

I should try listening to Yakety Sax the next time I fire KSP up. That might be quite amusing actually.

I too agree with the consensus I think - the theme is ok, as is the music in space. The VAB/SPH "jazz" is utterly dire, repetitive and caused me to mute the whole score.

I listen to either a streaming ambient station, or my own MP3's. The Gravity OST is nice, sometimes Jean Michelle Jarre, or the Sunshine OST. I'd like to see an MP3 player mod that can browse my music folders and maybe even read .pls files and streaming URL's...

First time I got into orbit and heard that music... oh boy it was so amazing.

Now... not so much after countless hours of space flight. We really need new songs. Something Homeworld style would be great.

Edited January 4, 2015 by diego999
typo
VAB xylophone song made me turn the music off. All the other songs are good.... but the xylophone... the xylophone...

I quite liked the music actually. Like others have said it conveys the whole empty space thing pretty well. That being said I haven't listened to it as far back as 0.18. Nowadays I've got KSP on one monitor and Scott Manley or HOCgaming videos on the other to get new design ideas.
